message: Democracy is not a spectator sport.
author: Barbara Jordan

message: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

message: Nothing worth having comes easy.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

message: Vote as if your life depends on it, because it does.
author: Unknown

message: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

message: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

message: A government that is afraid to look after its own people is a government that is doomed to fail.
author: Unknown

message: Politics is not about the people you elect; it's about the people who vote.
author: Unknown

message: Your silence will not protect you.
author: Audre Lorde

message: The most effective way to do it is to do it.
author: Amelia Earhart

message: When the people fear the government, there is tyranny. When the government fears the people, there is liberty.
author: Thomas Jefferson

message: We are stronger together than we could ever be alone.
author: Unknown

message: Courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.
author: Nelson Mandela

message: Access to the ballot is a fundamental right.
author: Unknown

message: Freedom is never voluntarily given by the oppressor; it must be demanded by the oppressed.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

message: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly, and applying the wrong remedies.
author: Groucho Marx

message: An informed citizenry is at the heart of a dynamic democracy.
author: Thomas Jefferson

message: The ultimate measure of a man is what he does with his power.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

message: You have to take the initiative and play your game. In a decisive moment, you have to be bold.
author: George W. Bush

message: Elections belong to the people. It's their decision.
author: Abraham Lincoln

message: Truth is powerful and it prevails.
author: Sojourner Truth

message: Together, we can build a better future.
author: Unknown

message: Leadership is about making others better as a result of your presence.
author: Sheryl Sandberg

message: The price of apathy towards public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.
author: Plato

message: Each of us is called to become a voice for the voiceless.
author: Unknown

message: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

message: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

message: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

message: Politics is the science of who gets what, when, and how.
author: Harold Laswell

message: We cannot seek achievement for ourselves and forget about progress and prosperity for our community.
author: Cesar Chavez

message: Democracy is the government of the people, by the people, for the people.
author: Abraham Lincoln

message: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

message: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

message: To deny people their human rights is to challenge their very humanity.
author: Nelson Mandela

message: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.
author: Albert Einstein

message: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

message: A vote is a powerful thing; it is the foundation of our democracy.
author: Unknown

message: Democracy is not a one-time event, but a way of life.
author: Unknown

message: Your vote is your voice; make sure it is heard.
author: Unknown

message: Politics is about the lives we touch.
author: Unknown

message: A democratic government should be accountable to its people.
author: Unknown

message: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

message: United we stand, divided we fall.
author: Aesop

message: Empathy fuels connection; disconnected we are lonely.
author: Bren√© Brown

message: The greatest danger in times of turbulence is not the turbulence; it is to act with yesterday's logic.
author: Peter Drucker

message: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
author: John C. Maxwell

message: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul.
author: Emily Dickinson

message: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
